DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cancer and Leukemia Group B Clinical Study Metabolic Pathway Enrollment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the patient is registering to the phaemacogenetic companion study 60202, a CALGB metabolic pathway study, a study of the known steps and interactions for the metabolism of a compound.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Cancer and Leukemia Group B Clinical Study Metabolic Pathway Enrollment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient enrollment in a CALGB metabolic pathway study, a study of the known steps and interactions for the metabolism of a compound.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Cancer and Leukemia Group B Clinical Study Metabolic Pathway Enrollment
Property.preferredDefinition: The Cancer and Leukemia Group B (CALGB) is a national clinical research group - network of 29 university medical centers, over 185 community hospitals and more than almost 3000 physicians - sponsored by the NCI, with its Central Office headquartered at the University of Chicago, and its Statistical Center located at Duke University, founded in 1955 with a goal of bringing together clinical and laboratory research.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :An elaboration of the known steps and interactions for the metabolism of a compound.:Enrollment; to insert, register, or enter in a list, catalog, or roll. (Merriam-Webster Online)

Concepts.definition: A national clinical research group - network of 29 university medical centers, over 185 community hospitals and more than almost 3000 physicians - sponsored by the NCI, with its Central Office headquartered at the University of Chicago, and its Statistical Center located at Duke University, founded in 1955 with a goal of bringing together clinical and laboratory research.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
An elaboration of the known steps and interactions for the metabolism of a compound.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
